42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:21): especially in April!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (04:24): Unfortunately it had all melted by the time I woke up (around 1pm) :-(
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:24): I took some photos...I suck at doing that, though they will appear on my blog eventually
3e7a854e7a0a1af7eba2005b0bdd4a1a (04:29): it was nice
3e7a854e7a0a1af7eba2005b0bdd4a1a (04:29): was shocked at how white it was
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:31): indeed, it was proper powder snow
3e7a854e7a0a1af7eba2005b0bdd4a1a (04:31): only light snow was forecast
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:34): e-mails the xhtml2 group
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:49): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - can you give a brief summary of the goals of your ongoing table work?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:49): is there are particular hypothesis you're working under?
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:50): it's mostly to understand how tables get authored in reality, so we can design HTML5 features to be more realistic and robust
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:50): particularly the table header association mechanism
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:51): where "we" means HTMLWG in general
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:52): I should probably summarise the goals in the document :P
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:53): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - yeah, that would be useful, I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:54): summary of what you've done so far, and what else you want to do going forward
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:54): what specific product/deliverable you have in mind
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:54): the document starts with a "Numbers" section which summarises what's been done
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:55): for example, we could end up producing/publishing a W3C Note from it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:55): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - what's the URL?
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:55): oh, sorry I thought you were looking at it! it's here: http://sitesurgeon.co.uk/tables/
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:56): deliverables include helping develop the HTML5 header association algorithm with other HTMLWG participants (James Graham and Simon Pieters, mostly)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:57): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - hmm, seems like that wouldn't be a specific deliverable but instead something the deliverable/document could be used for
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:58): have you gotten much feedback from WAI folks about it yet?
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:58): I don't recall talking to any WAI people about it yet
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): http://www.w3.org/2003/entities/2007xml/unicode.xml has a last-modified date of 1970
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:58): go w3c!
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (04:59): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, it was done in my spare time so I've not been tracking feedback around it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:59): removes the -N from his command line so that hsi script will always download the file instead of assuming that it has an accurate date
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:00): oh actually
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:00): that could be a minefield bug

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:00): nevermind

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:01): go minefield!

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:02): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - fwiw, I think it might be worthwhile to post the URL and short summary to one of the WAI lists
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:02): if you've not done that already
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (05:03): it's not under active development at the moment; I can't afford the time
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (05:04): I'd like it to be used by anyone who finds it useful, though
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:04): is getting lots of "Connection reset by peer http://intertwingly.net/blog/index.atom" when trying to get Sam's feed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:04): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - I see
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (05:05): I've been seeking sponsorship from various places to make the work more sustainable
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (05:05): I took the whole of last month off work to try and speed that up, but haven't quite got there

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - I would think investing some time in doing a little awareness-raising about might help with getting others to consider sponsoring further work
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:10): e.g., by posting about it to WAI lists or elsewhere
42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 (05:11): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, that's a good idea. can you suggest a specific list for me to post it to? I've only sent it to public-html before now.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:13): 42e76c77af424a4350ab0e3e3f6f2ce9 - no, I can't suggest any specific list. I don't follow them. Karl Dubost might know

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (05:14): both W3C staff for WAI
